question: 屋上
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Above</kanji> the <kanji>roof</kanji> is the <vocabulary>rooftop</vocabulary>. What else would be up there?
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You didn't learn this reading for <ja>屋</ja> though, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

One place in the world has more <vocabulary>rooftop</vocabulary>s than any where else, and that's <reading>Ok</reading>lahoma (<ja>おく</ja>). They get so many tornadoes that they need extra rooftops for when the first few blow off.
